title: Conrad Sewell responds to AFL National Anthem criticism
text:
Singer Conrad Sewell was slammed by AFL fans last month when he performed a rendition of Advance Australia Fair as part of the grand finale's pre-game entertainment.

Singing in front of a sell-out crowd at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, critics claimed he 'butchered' and 'murdered' the National Anthem, while other called it 'ghastly'.

Now, Conrad has addressed the negativity on KIIS FM's Kyle And Jackie O show in an expletive rant.

Scroll down for video

'If it's not Jimmy Barnes they think it's sh*t!' Conrad Sewell responds to AFL National Anthem criticism on the Kyle And Jackie O show (Pictured: AFL Grand Final, September 28, 2019)

'I cop s**t all the time but like, who gives a f**k. You know when you’re good and when you’re not,' he told host Kyle Sandilands and Jackie 'O' Henderson.

On the breakfast radio show, the 31-year-old acknowledged he 'copped s**t' for the performance, but admitted he is often confused by the public's backlash.

'It's something about Australia. They would prefer to focus on the negative and it’s annoying because you get off stage and you try your best and you’re always going to cop some kind of s**t,” he told co-hosts Kyle Sandilands and Jackie 'O' Henderson.

Kyle joked 'If it's not Barnesy (Jimmy Barnes) they think it's sh*t', to which Conrad laughed in agreement.

'I cop s**t all the time but like, who gives a f**k!' The 31-year-old acknowledged he 'copped s**t' for the performance, but refused to let it get to him

Ouch! Singing in front of a sell-out crowd at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, critics claimed Conrad 'butchered' and 'murdered' the National Anthem, while other called it 'ghastly

Working in the industry as a solo artist for five years, the Start Again singer said he has learnt to brush off negative attention and comments directed at him.

'You’ve got to have a thick skin in this industry you know,' Conrad said.

It's not the first time Conrad's performance have been slammed by critics, including another AFL-related performance the same week as the grand final.

Fans were not happy with the the Healing Hands hit-maker's performance at the Brownlow Medal ceremony.

He performed the song Remind Me during an in memoriam segment, but viewers were furious the coverage focused more on him than the deceased players.

Conrad rose to fame in 2014 when he partnered up with Norwegian DJ Kygo for his viral hit Firestone, which has 663 million YouTube views.
description: Singer Conrad Sewell was slammed by AFL fans last month when he performed a rendition of Advance Australia Fair as the grand finale's pre-game entertainment.
authors: Candice Jackson For Daily Mail Australia
